Key Match Events: Jason Heyward hit a home run in his first at bat to give Houston a 1-0 lead in the third.
Heyward had an RBI single in a four-run fourth that also included RBI singles from Peña and Mauricio Dubon.
Jake Meyers gave the Astros a 6-0 lead in the eighth on an RBI single to right.
Ward ended the Astros’ shutout bid with his home run in the eighth off Kaleb Ort, his 24th.
Post-Match Reflections: Heyward expressed satisfaction with stepping into another clubhouse with a winning mentality.
Blanco stated he made improvements to his fastball and attacked the strike zone more effectively.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Blanco threw six scoreless innings, allowing two walks and having five strikeouts.
Josh Hader recorded the final two outs for his 31st save in 33 opportunities.
The Angels lost their fifth consecutive game and fell for the seventh time in their last eight games.
Taylor Ward hit a home run for the Angels, his 24th of the season.
Angels rookie right-hander Caden Dana (1-2) went 3 1/3 innings in his third career start, giving up five runs on five hits with two walks and three strikeouts.
